intro: Tricyrtis viridula, commonly known as the green spurge orchid, is a herbaceous perennial native to Japan. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in shaded woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Tricyrtis viridula is also noted for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
